intro: Capparis woodii, commonly known as the desert fig, is a rare and critically endangered plant species native to the deserts of Israel and the Palestinian territories. It is characterized by its woody stems and small, fleshy leaves adapted to arid environments. The plant produces striking yellow flowers and edible, fig-like fruits that are highly sought after. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it faces significant conservation challenges. Its unique ecological role and ornamental value make it a subject of both scientific interest and conservation efforts.
